title: warning about non-sdf input should be demoted

content.raw:
When parsing something that's not SDF (e.g., `roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch`), I get this warning to console:

~~~
Warning [parser.cc:356] No <sdf> element in file[data-string]
~~~

Presumably, that's caused by the parser being given URDF, rather than SDF, input.  Given that we're still supporting URDF, it shouldn't be a warning.  Maybe an info statement, or better yet, just log it to file.
content.html:
When parsing something that's not SDF (e.g., roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch), I get this warning to console:

Warning [parser.cc:356] No <sdf> element in file[data-string]

Presumably, that's caused by the parser being given URDF, rather than SDF, input. Given that we're still supporting URDF, it shouldn't be a warning. Maybe an info statement, or better yet, just log it to file.
